items.text: Angular is a platform and framework for building single-page client applications using HTML and TypeScript. Angular is written in TypeScript. It implements core and optional functionality as a set of TypeScript libraries that you import into your apps.

The Angular community is split between AngularJS (released in 2010) and modern Angular (starting with Angular 2 in 2016). The new framework is called Angular, as opposed to the old AngularJS 1.x version.
Angular framework in its modern form includes versions from 2 to the most recent one – Angular 9, which was introduced in February 2020.

content.title: Angular belongs to the so-called MEAN stack. The acronym describes four technologies that cover major software product development aspects.
